text: The Beguiled masquerades as a Southern Gothic tale, with all the requisite grotesquerie. But beneath its frilly, corseted bodice, it ’ s a stone - cold revenge fantasy, laced with a potent cocktail of toxic comedy and pungent desire. The film ’ s fixation on revenge means it feels considerably tighter and simpler than its marketing might have led you to believe. This isn ’ t the wild, extravagant romp of director Sofia Coppola ’ s Marie Antoinette, nor does it lean so plainly on the hormonal teenage angst of The Virgin Suicides.
